event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should look at the fault logs on the XSCF to determine if there is some hardware problem that may be causing the upset. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Domain does not respond to the XSCF's request to reset itself.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Domain does not respond to the XSCF's request to reset itself.

The XSCF expects the domain to respond to periodic keep-alive messages,
but when this does not happen the following actions will be attempted:


   If the domain does not respond to a keep-alive message,
    then the XSCF will send the domain a request telling it to panic.

   If the domain does not panic,
    then the XSCF will send an XIR interrupt to the domain.

   If the domain does not respond to the XIR interrupt,
    then the XSCF will attempt to reset the domain.

   If the domain reset does not occur,
    then the XSCF will power the domain down.


This particular upset occurred because the domain did not respond to the XSCF's request to reset itself.

The lack of response is probably due to a hardware problem on the domain.

The XSCF will power the domain down.
 
The system administrator should examine output displayed to the XSCF console, domain's console,
domain logs files (/var/adm/messages, fmdump -v) and XSCF logs files (fmdump -m, fmdump -v) to
gain a further understanding of the problem.


  If there is no explanation why the domain did not respond to the XSCF's request to reset itself,  
  then proceed with the steps outlined below.


       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:41:45 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 06d5e1f3-9ff1-49f8-9af6-33ac90fa718a
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/ SCF-8005-WY for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8005-WY, TYPE: Upset, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:41:45 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 06d5e1f3-9ff1-49f8-9af6-33ac90fa718a
   DESC: Domain does not respond to the XSCF's request to reset itself.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-WY for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The XSCF will power the domain down.
   IMPACT: The XSCF will power the domain down.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should look at the fault logs on the XSCF to determine if there is
   some hardware problem that may be causing the upset. Please consult the detail section of
   the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 06d5e1f3-9ff1-49f8-9af6-33ac90fa718a

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:41:45.7204 06d5e1f3-9ff1-49f8-9af6-33ac90fa718a SCF-8005-WY
           100%  upset.chassis.domain.keepalive.reset-fail

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/domain=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0/component=CHASSIS



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCF will power the domain down.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCF will power the domain down.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Domain does not respond to the XSCF.
